pr_title: Do not silently ignore *Test test classes

timeline.bodyText: Should we add a check which would fail a build if *Test.java is found instead?
timeline.author: losipiuk
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -1353,7 +1353,9 @@
                 <artifactId>maven-surefire-plugin</artifactId>
                 <configuration>
                     <includes>
+                        <!-- Tests classes should start with "Test", but we do also want to include tests incorrectly named, with "Test" at the end -->
                         <include>**/Test*.java</include>
+                        <include>**/*Test.java</include>

replies.bodyText: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/42341897/how-can-i-check-if-a-filename-in-my-maven-project-contains-certain-characters-a shows (not very elegant) way to achieve this.
replies.author: losipiuk

timeline.bodyText: Ill looks like an abbreviation. How about Incorrectly
timeline.author: electrum

replies.bodyText: This is for "ill-named." I don't think it matters anyway. I will keep as is
replies.author: findepi

timeline.message:
Do not silently ignore *Test test classes

Before this commit, test classes named *Test (but not starting with
"Test"), e.g. those generated by an IDE, would be ignored on CI.
